thread.title: Rio aims to cut more iron ore costs
thread.title_full: Rio aims to cut more iron ore costs

title: Rio aims to cut more iron ore costs
text:
Thu, Sep 3, 2015, 5:03 PM NZST - New Zealand Markets closed Rio aims to cut more iron ore costs AAP – 1 hour 4 minutes ago Recommend Print 
Mining giant Rio Tinto has outlined plans to cut more costs from its iron ore operations as it deals with falling prices. 
The company said its iron ore operating costs have already been reduced by $US1 billion over three years, and it has about 400 initiatives underway to identify further savings and ways to lift productivity. 
Maintenance costs will also be cut by $200 million a year over the next three years, Rio said. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Retail spending slips a little in July AAP 
Retail spending has fallen for the first time in over a year, dragged down by a drop in spending on household goods. … % Chg Your most recently viewed tickers will automatically show up here if you type a ticker in the "Enter symbol/company" at the bottom of this module.
